Mona Azami

Web Developer & Graphic Designer

About Me

Let me tell you about myself...

After 15 hours, my flight landed in Heathrow airport in December 2010. from the first moment I stepped out of the plane I knew a new chapter in my life had begun. As we drove towards my friend’s house all my life came before me as if I was watching a movie in which I was the star. I remembered the day I became a mother and gave up a career in graphic design which had lasted 7 years for a more important job. a job which changed me forever. After 24 hours I realised that I had given birth to a miracle. My son was diagnosed with multiple heart defects some of which were so rare not every doctor had heard of. As My son’s medical treatment advanced I got a chance to connect with people who had experienced tragedy and despair. At that point I realised I could relate and understand them and even help them overcome their issues as I had passed that crossroad between falling into despair or moving forward and making my life better. I volunteered in a charity organisation whose mission was to provide refugees and asylum seekers with basic education and support. After a while I noticed in order to help others I needed to improve myself so I started an art and design course in Teesside University. once I moved to London from Hartlepool I found myself being swarmed with opportunities. Code your Future , a newborn charity dedicated to help people like me to make a career in programming, seemed the right choice. It was never enough just to rely on what I was taught and I realised I have to study on my own. If I had learned one thing along my journey is that there is no end to learning and what makes me stronger is taking on new chanllenges.
